description: Sahana Pradhan (17 June 1927 – 22 September 2014) was a Nepalese politician from a Newar family. She served as Deputy Prime Minister of Nepal from 2007 to 2008 and as Minister of Foreign Affairs from April 2007 to August 2008. Previously, she held the position of Minister of Industry and Commerce from 1990 to 1991. Married to communist leader Pushpa Lal Shrestha, she was a prominent figure in Nepal's communist movement. She led the Communist Party of Nepal starting in 1986 and later chaired the Communist Party of Nepal (Marxist-Leninist) from 1998 until it merged back into the CPN(UML) in 2002.
short_description: Nepalese politician who served as Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Foreign Affairs of Nepal.
